entries.title: Moderna says RSV vaccine is 84% effective at preventing disease in older adults
entries.description: RSV infections kill between 6,000 and 10,000 older adults every year and result in 60,000 to 120,000 hospitalizations, according to the CDC.

entries.title: FTX says $415 million of crypto was hacked
entries.description: FTX management updated its estimated asset recoveries to $5.5 billion, and offered a new breakdown of over $400 million worth of missing assets.

entries.title: GM reveals new Chevy Corvette E-Ray hybrid sports car, starting at over $104,000
entries.description: The 2024 Chevrolet Corvette E-Ray hybrid will be the quickest production version ever of the American sports car.

entries.title: Gen Z is driving luxury sales as wealthy shoppers get younger
entries.description: Analysts and luxury executives say the appeal of luxury brands to ever-younger consumers is tied to a surge in wealth creation over the past few years, along with social media.

entries.title: Biden is 'fully cooperating' with DOJ probe of his handling of classified documents, White House says
entries.description: "It's important to really understand the distinction here: President Biden is committed to doing the responsible thing and acting appropriately."

entries.title: Netflix is hiring a flight attendant for one of its private jets—and the job pays up to $385,000
entries.description: The role demands "flexibility to work a varied work schedule, often requiring weekend and holiday work days and extended travel periods."

entries.title: Russia needs the opportunity to rejoin an international system after any peace deal, Kissinger says
entries.description: The former U.S. secretary of state also told the World Economic Forum that the West should continue to engage in talks with Russia.

entries.title: Bitcoin has now recovered all its losses since FTX collapsed
entries.description: Bitcoin's rally has propelled it to fresh highs, as it fully recovers from the losses incurred in FTX's collapse even as the crypto industry braces for tumult.

entries.title: Tech executives could be jailed for deliberately failing to protect kids under UK proposal
entries.description: The U.K.'s culture and digital minister stressed in a statement that the change "will not affect those who have acted in good faith."

entries.title: Hungary's foreign minister says Brussels has failed on Russia sanctions
entries.description: "Europe's economy is suffering more from sanctions than the Russian economy," Péter Szijjártó told CNBC.

entries.title: German finance minister says country will likely face a 'very mild' recession this year
entries.description: German Finance Minister Christian Lindner said Tuesday that he believed the country would experience a mild recession in 2023.

entries.title: Actors Idris and Sabrina Dhowre Elba on how their parents inspired their activism
entries.description: Actors Idris Elba and Sabrina Dhowre Elba say their parents were driving forces behind their own activism today, which focuses on food security.

entries.title: Apple announces new Macs with its most powerful chips yet
entries.description: Apple announced an updated Mac Mini and refreshed MacBook Pros with its latest M2 chips.

entries.title: Qatar does not advocate 'forgive and forget' for Russia, foreign minister says after colleague's controversial remarks
entries.description: "Qatar has a very clear political stance on this: we don't accept the invasion of another country," Foreign Minister Mohammed al-Thani told CNBC.

entries.title: Putin is a tyrant who wants to enslave Ukraine, Poland's president says
entries.description: Poland's President Andrzej Duda has slammed his Russian counterpart, saying Vladimir Putin is behaving like a tyrant and colonialist by invading Ukraine.

entries.title: Prices have not peaked yet, says CEO of one of the world's largest consumer goods firms
entries.description: Alan Jope was speaking to CNBC's Joumanna Bercetche at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

entries.title: World must abandon Cold War mentality, China's vice premier tells Davos
entries.description: China's Vice Premier Liu He said that the world "needs to abandon its Cold War mentality" and seek to strengthen international cooperation.

entries.title: Dubai continues to benefit from crisis and the Russia-Ukraine war, Damac chair says
entries.description: Property transactions in Dubai year-to-date hit a record high by the end of 2022, surpassing previous records reached over the same period of 2009.

entries.title: Ukraine has repeatedly pleaded for tanks to fight Russia — its Western allies could now be ready to provide them
entries.description: Ukraine has repeatedly asked its Western allies to provide it with tanks to help it fight Russia. A reluctance to answer those calls could be about to change.

entries.title: SAP CEO says the world is entering the 'next phase of globalization'
entries.description: The CEO of German tech giant SAP said the world is entering the next phase of globalization — and he's largely optimistic on the outlook for technology.

entries.title: EU announces new green proposals to rival Biden's Inflation Reduction Act
entries.description: The president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, said Tuesday her institution was drafting a new law targeting the region's green industries.

entries.title: ECB's Centeno projects 'a few' more rate hikes in the next couple of meetings 'at least'
entries.description: The European Central Bank is likely to go ahead with "at least" a few more rate hikes in the next couple of meetings, Mario Centeno, governor of the Bank of Portugal told CNBC.

entries.title: 'The year of inflection': Top bank CEOs weigh in on inflation outlook
entries.description: On the sidelines of the World Economic Forum in Davos, Switzerland, UBS CEO Ralph Hamers said 2023 will be "the year of inflection" for the global economy.

entries.title: Idea of de-globalization is a 'mirage,' says historian Niall Ferguson
entries.description: The Hoover Institution senior fellow said the idea that globalization has peaked is not borne out by data.

entries.title: Boris Pistorius to become Germany's next defense minister
entries.description: he interior minister of the state of Lower Saxony, Boris Pistorius, will become Germany's next defense minister, the government said Tuesday.

entries.title: The worst is over for the global chip shortage, ABB chairman says: 'I'm quite optimistic'
entries.description: Asked whether supply chain issues in the chip industry have been resolved, ABB's Peter Voser said that he believes the worst of the shortage has now subsided.

entries.title: IEA chief lauds U.S. Inflation Reduction Act as most important climate agreement since Paris accord
entries.description: Speaking on the same panel, Occidental Petroleum CEO Vicki Hollub described the IRA as one of the most transformative bills in the world.

entries.title: China's economy could recover faster and earlier than expected, analysts say
entries.description: China may have marked one of the worst years of economic growth on record, but its shorter-term data showed things might get better sooner.

entries.title: UK house prices to fall by up to 10% this year, Lloyds Bank CEO says
entries.description: U.K. house prices will fall by up to 10% this year, as higher mortgage rates and the broader cost of living crisis curtail home buying, Lloyds Bank CEO Charlie Nunn told CNBC on Tuesday.

entries.title: John Kerry says 'money, money, money' is needed most to tackle climate change
entries.description: The U.S. special presidential envoy for climate was speaking at the World Economic Forum in Davos.

entries.title: Chinese travelers are returning to Singapore, but a full recovery is not expected this year
entries.description: Singapore is welcoming travelers from China, but tourist numbers may return to just 30%-60% of pre-pandemic numbers by year-end.

entries.title: IMF chief: Growth will bottom out in 2023 and bounce back next year
entries.description: IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva told CNBC Tuesday that the days of her institution giving global growth downgrades are over.

entries.title: Market environment was one of the worst imaginable in 2022, insurer Allianz says
entries.description: The CEO of Allianz said the German insurer proved to be "very resilient" through what he described as one of the worst environments imaginable in 2022.

entries.title: CEOs are the most pessimistic they've been in more than a decade as world faces a slowdown
entries.description: Some 73% of CEOs think global growth will decline in the next year, which is the most pessimistic outlook in 12 years, according to a new survey by PwC.

entries.title: Top business leaders discuss financial innovation at the World Economic Forum
entries.description: Moderated by CNBC's Steve Sedgwick, top business leaders discuss at Davos, Switzerland, how financial actors respond to ongoing disruptions while keeping pace with technological advancement.

entries.title: China's reopening will boost Hong Kong markets despite weak GDP print, HKEX chairman says
entries.description: Hong Kong markets are set to benefit from the reopening of the Chinese economy, despite Beijing's disappointing annual GDP growth rate in 2022, according to HKEX Chairman Laura Cha.

entries.title: Goldman Sachs is set to report fourth-quarter earnings — here's what the Street expects
entries.description: How long will the investment banking drought last? That's one of the top questions analysts will have for Goldman CEO David Solomon.

entries.title: China’s population drops for the first time in decades
entries.description: China was widely expected Tuesday to report its first population decline in decades.

entries.title: China reports 3% GDP growth for 2022
entries.description: China's GDP for 2022 was expected to have grown by its slowest since 2020, the year the pandemic began.

entries.title: Adidas says Berlin Fashion Week launch and co-CEO announcements are fake
entries.description: The Yes Men, an activist group that has a history of creating spoofs to draw attention to corporations, said it was behind the releases.
